now to something completely different
now this can be many different types of

now again we might not even have a

it won't be a reserve currency of one

it's backed by something tangible on the
local level well we understand that it
might be digital again the central banks
there's many things happening all at
once here the central banks they want to
control the currency they always have
they always will and it doesn't matter
if it's paper it doesn't matter if it's

is its centralized even though
everyone's talking about the blockchain
technology bitcoin litecoin all the
different coins we need to understand
there still can be control of this
technology because what we see is
there's corporations that are being
formed where they use this technology
they
develop this technology they control
this technology same thing with the
central banks what they want to do is
they want to develop and control and
have everyone use this digital system
and it won't be a truth type of system
because they still will be able to
manipulate it remember just because it's
a blockchain type of technology it
doesn't mean those who are in control
those who are fiddling with it writing
the code well they still have the
ability to manipulate it in their way so
when we look at this we want this to be
completely decentralized we don't want a
central point where they're controlling
all of this and what we're seeing is
that central bank's banks they are
getting ready for this transition and
they want to be in control going to be
talking about this in a little bit now
what we're seeing here is the economy
well its continually deteriorating it's
not improving and we're already starting
to see signs where they're starting to
blame this on Trump now we knew this
eventually was going to happen we have
the National Association of Homebuilders
they are out there and they're saying
that well we have a problem with new
homes and the confidence is dropping
amongst home builders and they're
blaming this on Trump why because of the
Canadian lumber Kerris that he imposed
me they're saying it's become
unaffordable to build these homes and
what we're seeing right now is that
single-family sales they have fallen
from 72 to 74 single-family homes have
fallen from 75 to 73 we see that
prospective buyers traffic has fallen
from 49 to 48 and they're out there
saying listen because of what Trump is
doing his policies and he really does
not have that many policies in place
right now yes he has this one
Arif but when you look closely added and
this is again coming from the National
Association of Homebuilders chairman
Granger McDonald he's saying that our
members are telling us they are growing

is hurting housing affordability even as

remains very very strong now again
looking at the lumber prices when you
look at them they are still below the
April 25th levels when Trump invoked the
tariff so when they talk about raising
costs and the problem with lumber it
really doesn't exist what they're really
seeing is that the system is breaking
down
I remember going back in time to three
years ago when the corporate media when
everyone was out there saying that oh
the retail sales they're not doing well
because it snowed on this day and
remember it only snowed in one portion

ninety eight percent of the country they

then they started to blame it online

they're using online they're using

is happening in the real estate market
in the new construction market they're

is that these lumber prices where
they're going to be complaining about
the prices they're
really not going to move just like we've
seen since April 25th they haven't

they've been in they've been purchasing

because they accounted for half of the

is shaping up to have the lowest cell
count since the period from 2008 to 2010
and what is happening right now is these
foreign
investors they're drying up right now if

York
leasing volume in the second quarter

downtown arose 12.1 percent up from ten

not just happening in Manhattan it's
happening in many different cities so
this is an ongoing situation and what

where everything started to decline we
were pumped up from 2011 all the way to

onward and it's accelerating right now
and we saw the same thing happen back

this fake economy it's coming to an end
that's what all this is telling us now
US imports and exports them before the

that we're starting to see the same

now we're starting to see that the
import the import price index from China

all of a sudden everything just started

only last four or five years and then
they pop and then we have bubbles that

but the same theme does occur where they

they realize this is coming Trump

they don't want made in America they

they're duplicating everything that

they have a system that looks just like

we've been reporting on all of this and
what we've seen is that yes everything
that we've been talking about well here
we are
everything is prepared and ready and now
we're getting ready to take the next

is cryptocurrency where this is coming
into the mainstream here people are
looking at this it's an efficient system
to use currency to basically use it as a

decentralized where each system around
the world has a ledger and each system
checks with another to make sure that
yes these transactions are true and each
ledger keeps every single transaction
going back throughout time and it checks

what's this what makes it a truth
machine now the problem is is if the

they would get they would like to get
rid of paper but they want to be in

were they filed this patent back in 2015
they already knew what was happening
they understood and central banks are
doing the same thing other banking
systems are doing the same thing because
their idea is to maintain
control of all this to own the patents

system
and the people who want to be separate

created because the ledgers are spread

the amount but each transaction
transaction so it can be recreated at

once again if we're trading these
